snippet: The N.F.L. commissioner said that expansion was not being considered "at all" and that the league preferred teams to stay where they were.
abstract: The N.F.L. commissioner said that expansion was not being considered "at all" and that the league preferred teams to stay where they were.
lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS -- At his state of the league news conference Friday, Commissioner Roger Goodell said that expansion was not being considered "at all", and that the N.F.L. preferred that teams stayed in their current cities.

headline.main: Goodell Says No Expansion Is Being Considered
